title: 115_hr3059
content: The Act may be cited as the "Community Health Center and Primary Care Workforce Expansion Act of 2017". This Act pertains to the Community Health Center Program. The Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act is amended to allocate increasing funds for fiscal years 2018 to 2027. The Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act authorizes increasing funds for community health centers program under section 330 of the Public Health Service Act for fiscal years 2027 and beyond, adjusted based on cost and patient increase percentages. The Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act authorizes increasing funds for community health centers program under section 330 of the Public Health Service Act for fiscal years 2027 and beyond, adjusted based on cost and patient increase percentages. $18,600,000,000 is allocated for capital projects in fiscal year 2017, with a limitation that amounts for community health centers cannot be reduced due to these appropriations. The funds appropriated under this section will remain available until expended. The National Health Service Corps is established under the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act. The Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act amends Section 10503(b)(2) to allocate increasing funds for fiscal years 2018 to 2027 to the National Health Service Corps. For fiscal year 2028 and beyond, funding for the National Health Service Corps will be adjusted based on the increase in health professions education costs and the change in individuals residing in health professions shortage areas. The National Health Service Corps funding for fiscal year 2028 and beyond will be adjusted based on health professions education costs and individuals in shortage areas. Appropriated funds shall remain available until expended, and limitations prevent reductions in funding for the Corps. SEC. 4. TEACHING HEALTH CENTERS. Section 340H(g) of the Public Health Service Act is amended to allocate specific funding amounts for fiscal years 2018 to 2028, with adjustments based on the annual percentage increase in the medical care component of the consumer price index. The appropriations for Teaching Health Centers are protected from reduction under this section, and funds allocated here will remain available until expended. SEC. 5. Nurse Practitioner Residency Training Programs. The Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act is amended to authorize increasing appropriations for fiscal years 2018 to 2028 to carry out Section 5316. The Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act authorizes increased appropriations for Nurse Practitioner Residency Training Programs for fiscal years 2018 to 2028. The funds appropriated shall be adjusted annually based on the medical care component of the consumer price index or the percentage increase under a specific section of the Act. Amounts allocated for the training programs cannot be reduced due to these appropriations, and the funds will remain available until expended.
